action.action-desc: Mr. Miller of Ohio introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restrict the advanced manufacturing production credit with respect to components produced by, or in connection with, foreign entities of concern.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safeguarding U.S. Supply Chains Act.

section.header: Restriction on advanced manufacturing production credit with respect to foreign entities of concern

subsection.header: Credit not allowed for components produced by foreign entities of concern
subsection.text: Section 45X(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Credit not allowed for components produced by foreign entities of concern
paragraph.text: No credit shall be allowed under this section with respect to any eligible component which is produced by a foreign entity of concern (as defined in section 9901(8) of the William M. Mac Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (15 U.S.C. 4651(8))).

subsection.header: Additional restrictions with respect to qualifying battery components
subsection.text: Section 45X(c)(5) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Prohibition on certain involvement of foreign entities of concern
subparagraph.text: The term qualifying battery component shall not include any battery component produced using technology designed, developed, manufactured, licensed, or supplied by a foreign entity of concern (as defined in section 9901(8) of the William M. Mac Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (15 U.S.C. 4651(8))).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to components produced and sold after the date of the enactment of this Act.
